Record.Value: In this lesson, we'll teach you how to build a basic platform to use as your first base. The materials used in this tutorial will be found upon entering any new world.
The {SLOT:Belt} is one of your most important storage places. It holds the tools you need to build and deconstruct things.
Let's opening it up. Press and hold the {KEY:MouseControl} key and click on the {SLOT:Belt}, or press the {KEY:ToolBeltSlot} key.
Now, grab the welding torch. Hold the {KEY:MouseControl} key and drag the welding torch from the {SLOT:Belt} into your right-hand slot.
Good job, Cadet. Let’s start building a base.
Press the {KEY:SwapHands} key to swap your active hand, then move over to the nearby crate. Pick up {THING:ItemIronFrames} from the crate with your left hand.

Now that you have a basic idea of how to use the UI, lets try some basic building. Go over to the highlighted area with the frames in your active hand. Tap {KEY:SecondaryAction} to enable the cursor and hold down the {KEY:PrimaryAction} button until it completes.

Currently, our {THING:ItemIronFrames} are not airtight. To complete the {THING:ItemIronFrames} we need to weld iron sheets onto it. If you haven't already, tap {KEY:SecondaryAction} button to remove the cursor object from the screen.
Go back to the crate and swap the frames for {THING:ItemIronSheets} by pressing {KEY:PrimaryAction} button while holding the {THING:ItemIronFrames}.

Return to your placed frames and equip the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} from your ToolBelt. Turn it on with {KEY:ToggleHandPower} key, then hold {KEY:PrimaryAction} button to build the frame until complete. You must be holding {THING:ItemIronSheets} in your other hand to do this. Note: Don't forget to turn off the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} when you're done by pressing the {KEY:ToggleHandPower} key.
Finish the {THING:ItemIronFrames} by continuing to wield it.

Well done, Cadet! Now that you've built your first frame, use what you’ve learned to build more {THING:ItemIronFrames} in the highlighted areas.
Hint: If you fall into a frame and get stuck, activate your Jetpack using the {KEY:Jetpack} key and fly out. Disable it with the same key.
Doing it on your own part 2.
Well done! Now, finish them off with the {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} and some {THING:ItemIronSheets}.
Cadet, it looks like the arc furnace has been buried by sand. We'll need to deconstruct it and move it to the new work platform. Deconstructing things is as easy as building them.
Nicely done, Cadet. Next up, we need to build an {THING:ItemKitArcFurnace}. This will be used to smelt ores into usable ingots.
Place the deconstructed {THING:StructureArcFurnace} in the highlighted area. You may need to use {KEY:QuantityModifier} to rotate the object to the correct position.
Cadet, the {THING:StructureAutolathe} is in the incorrect position. To move it, you will need to deconstruct it.
Use the {THING:ItemAngleGrinder} from your toolbelt to remove the plastic sheeting from the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
Use your {THING:ItemWireCutters} to remove the cabling from the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
Use the {THING:ItemAngleGrinder} to remove the Iron Sheeting from the {THING:StructureAutolathe}.
Finally, use the {THING:ItemWrench} to pack the {THING:StructureAutolathe} into a {THING:ItemKitAutolathe}.

We’re almost there. The final step is to build the {THING:StructureAutolathe}. The {THING:ItemKitAutolathe} can create a wide range of materials and machinery kits using ingots and power as its resources.
Construct the {THING:ItemKitAutolathe} in the highlighted area. Remember, you may need to use {KEY:QuantityModifier} key to rotate it.
Some items like the {THING:ItemKitAutolathe} are more difficult to construct, with more stages in the construction process.
Use the {THING:ItemCableCoil} to wire up the Autolathe's internals.
Finally, screw the front panel on with the {THING:ItemScrewdriver}.
